configuration.mailchimp_subject_line: Use a Seeed sensor to monitor your garden, bring your model railroad to life, learn everything you need to get started with LoRa
configuration.mailchimp_preview_text: Monthly updates on projects, features, and events from balena May 2022

featured.text:
Dear Reader,

This month, balenaForums member bversluijs shared his expertise on using openbalena to manage fleets and to prototype ideas. In his blog post he teaches you how to use an external AWS S3 provider for openbalena instead of using the integrated Minio S3 container. Check out the whole tutorial.

Also in this months email:
  • Connect a Seeed sensor to monitor your garden
  • Bring your model railroad to life
  • Catch up on the 3rd balenaHub Meetup and learn about LoRa
  • Discover the winning balena Hack Week project
  • Join us at Embedded World 2022
  • Register for the next balenaHub meetup

news.title: Connect a Seeed sensor with your balena Helium Data-Only Hotspot on Datacake
news.text: ​​In this tutorial, we add a practical gardening use case to the Helium hotspot: monitoring the temperature and moisture level of plants outside (while mining a small amount of $HNT depending on the type of equipment you use!).

news.title: Bring your model railroad to life with balena
news.text: In this tutorial, our latest balena resident graduate reflects on his first few months at balena and teaches you how to bring your model railroad to life with LED, movement, and sound automation using balena.

news.title: Catch up on the latest balenaHub Meetup on LoRa and LoRaWAN
news.text: At the May balenaHub meetup, Developer Advocate Marc Pous and balena Ambassador Xosé Pérez discussed how LoRa works and showcased the balenaHub applications available to run your own Lora gateway or LoRaWAN network server and answered your questions.

news.title: Check out the winning balena Hack Week project
news.text: Our Hack Week is an internal company hackathon where we hack together on new projects to help improve users' experience of balena. We then vote for our favorites as part of a friendly competition.

projects.title: Join us at Embedded World 2022
projects.text: Are you attending Embedded World in Nuremberg this month? Join the IoT Stars Developers Workshop by Blues Wireless, balena and Datacake and learn how to build IoT projects using powerful development tools for the connectivity, the edge, ML and data visualization.

projects.title: balenaHub Meetup #3 - Home Automation
projects.text: Join us for the 3rd balenaHub community Meetup to discuss Home Automation and learn more about deploying the home automation projects you can find on Hub. Register your spot now.

projects.title: balena Customer Seeed show us how they scaled
projects.text: The Helium hotspot manufacturer Seeed wrote this article to show us how they remotely manage their devices and perform over the air updates at scale using balena.

projects.title: Build IBM MicroShift with balena
projects.text: MicroShift is a research project that is exploring how OpenShift OKD Kubernetes distribution can be optimized for small form factor devices and edge computing. Learn how to deploy it with balenaOS in this blog post.

projects.title: Deploy more easily with Tilt
projects.text: Tilt is a toolkit for fixing the pains of microservice development. In this blog post, a balena community member shows us how Tilt can save you needing to manually rebuild your docker compose file.
